content.text: Show that \(\cos \theta \cot \theta + \sin \theta = \cos \mathrm{e} \theta\)
Hence solve \(\cos \theta \cot \theta + \sin \theta = 4\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 90^{\circ}\)
On the Venn diagram below, shade the region that represents \(A \cap B'\)
The universal set \(\mathcal{E}\) and sets \(P, Q\) and \(R\) are such that

content.blockMath: \[(P\cup Q\cup R)' = \emptyset , \qquad P'\cap (Q\cap R) = \emptyset , \\ \mathrm{n}(Q\cap R) = 8 , \qquad \mathrm{n}(P\cap R) = 8 , \qquad \mathrm{n}(P\cap Q) = 10 , \\ \mathrm{n}(P) = 21 , \qquad \mathrm{n}(Q) = 15 , \qquad \mathrm{n}(\mathcal{E}) = 30 .\]

content.text: Complete the Venn diagram to show this information and state the value of \(\mathrm{n}(R)\)

It is given that \(x + 3\) is a factor of the polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + ax^{2} - 24x + b\) . The remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 2\) is \(-15\). Find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 1\). [6]
Find the coordinates of the points where the line \(2y - 3x = 6\) intersects the curve \(\frac{x^2}{4} + \frac{y^2}{9} = 5\). [5]
Four parts in a play are to be given to four of the girls chosen from the seven girls in a drama class. Find the number of different ways in which this can be done. [2]
no Chinese singer is chosen,
one singer of each nationality is chosen,
the three singers chosen are all of the same nationality
Three singers are chosen at random from a group of 5 Chinese, 4 Indian and 2 British singers. Find the number of different ways in which this can be done if
Find the total perimeter of the shaded regions
Find the total area of the shaded regions

In the diagram, \(ABC\) is an arc of the circle centre \(O\), radius \(5\mathrm{cm}\), and angle \(AOC\) is \(1.5\) radians. \(AD\) and \(CE\) are diameters of the circle and \(DE\) is a straight line
the exact value of \(\left|\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{c}\right|\),
the value of the constant \(m\) such that \(\mathbf{a} + m\mathbf{b}\) is parallel to \(\mathbf{j}\),
the value of the constant \(n\) such that \(\text{na} - \text{b} = \text{c}\)
Vectors \(\mathbf{i}\) and \(\mathbf{j}\) are vectors parallel to the \(x\) -axis and \(y\) -axis respectively
Given that \(\mathbf{a} = 2\mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{j}\) , \(\mathbf{b} = \mathbf{i} - 5\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{c} = 3\mathbf{i} + 11\mathbf{j}\) , find
\(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 1 & -3 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -2 \\ 3 & -5 \end{pmatrix}\). Find \((\mathbf{BA})^{-1}\)
State the order of the matrix \(\mathbf{C}\)
Find the matrix \(\mathbf{X}\)
The matrix \(\mathbf{X}\) is such that \(\mathbf{X}\mathbf{C} = \mathbf{D}\), where \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 5 & 3 \\ 0 & 10 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{D} = (-4 \quad 5 \quad 4)\)
Differentiate \(x^{4}(\sqrt{\sin x})\) with respect to \(x\)
Hence find \(\int \left(x + \frac{x^4 \cos x}{\sqrt{\sin x}} + 8x^3 (\sqrt{\sin x})\right) \mathrm{d}x.\)
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(\ y = |(x + 3)(x - 5)|\) showing the coordinates of the points where the curve meets the \(x\)-axis. [2]
Write down a suitable domain for the function \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \left|(x + 3)(x - 5)\right|\) such that f has an inverse. [1]
Find \(\mathrm{hg}(x)\)
Find \((\mathrm{hg})^{-1}(x)\)
The functions g and h are defined by
Given that \(\mathrm{p}(a) = b\) and that the function p has an inverse, write down \(\mathrm{p}^{-1}(b)\)
Find \(\int \sqrt[3]{2x - 1} \mathrm{d}x\)
Find \(\int \sin 4x \mathrm{d}x\)
Hence evaluate \(\int_{\frac{\pi}{8}}^{\frac{\pi}{4}} \sin 4x \mathrm{d}x\)
Show that \(\int_{0}^{\ln 8} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{x}{3}} \mathrm{d}x = 3\)
Find an expression for \(r\) in terms of \(h\) and show that the volume of water in the cup is given by
Water is poured into the cup at a rate of \(30 \mathrm{cm}^3 \mathrm{s}^{-1}\). Find, correct to 2 decimal places, the rate at which the depth of water is increasing when \(h = 5\)
In this question all lengths are in centimetres
The volume of a cone of height \(h\) and base radius \(r\) is given by \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\)
It is known that \(\sin \frac{\pi}{12} = \frac{\sqrt{6} - \sqrt{2}}{4}\) , \(\cos \frac{\pi}{12} = \frac{\sqrt{6} + \sqrt{2}}{4}\) , \(\tan \frac{\pi}{12} = 2 - \sqrt{3}\)

A water cup is in the shape of a cone with its axis vertical. The diagrams show the cup and its cross-section. The vertical angle of the cone is \(\frac{\pi}{6}\) radians. The depth of water in the cup is \(h\). The surface of the water is a circle of radius \(r\)
